subsection.name: Modularity
subsection.p: XPontus is now built on top of a plugin framework to allow a modular development. Most of XPontus features are provided as plugins.

subsection.name: Code completion
subsection.p: For general XML files code completion is built on the fly when a DTD or schema is associated to the document. XSL completion is provided using a DTD embedded in the XML code completion plugin.
For HTML files, an embedded DTD is used to create the code completion database.

subsection.name: Syntax highlighting
subsection.p: Syntax coloring is enabled for XML and HTML related files

subsection.name: XSL transformations
subsection.p: Like in the previous versions, XSL transformations are available(PDF, HTML, XML, SVG, TEXT).

ul.li: The Simple validation plugin can validate an opened document only
The Batch XML validation can accept a list of files and/or directories and validate them based on some file extensions patterns(*.xml, *.xsl)
he External schema validation plugin validates a file against an external schema(ie when the document has no associated schema)

subsection.name: Code structure browser
subsection.p: XPontus can display the hierarchic structure of XML and HTML files

subsection.name: Code indentation
subsection.p: Code indentation is available for XML and HTML files.

subsection.name: File system abstractions
subsection.p: XPontus will be able to use file system abstraction which means that a FTP file and a local file will be look all the same to the application.

subsection.name: Schema generation/conversion
subsection.p: The software can generate DTDS, XML schemas, Relax NG grammars from XML files.

subsection.name: Multiple installers
subsection.p: Installers are available for Windows, Linux(Debian/Ubuntu, Suse/Fedora, Slackware), Unix, FreeBSD, Mac OS. There is also a cross platform installer

subsection.name: Platform interoperability
subsection.p: As XPontus is written Java, it runs on most platforms such as Windows, Linux/Unix, FreeBSD, MacOS.
